item.title: About Me
item.description: My name is Zoe and I like learning things! I learned to code a few years ago and have been exploring programming, computers and data ever since. Some fun facts about me: I am the President of BayGeo, a local Bay Area organization dedicated to bringing together geospatial and mapping enthusiasts. I learned to play basketball by starting a women + non-binary basketball team 6 years ago. I played twice a week until shelter in place.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Dasparities in Compliance with the Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA) My master’s thesis was a spatial environmental justice investigation into violations to the SDWA in Pennsylvania. My research was published in August 2020 in Applied Geography. I have also written a lot of code around this project and completely redid my thesis research but with New Jersey data. While unfortunately the the final website isn’t currently being hosted anywhere, all the code can be found here.

item.title: Hello!
item.description: What I am currently trying to learn: Scala CS Basics + Algorithms
